query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Già era ’l sole a l’orizzonte giunto 2 lo cui meridïan cerchio coverchia 3 Ierusalèm col suo più alto punto;
query.error: **English:** 1 Already the sun had reached the horizon 2 whose meridian circle covers 3 Jerusalem with its highest point;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e la notte, che opposita a lui cerchia, 5 uscia di Gange fuor con le Bilance, 6 che le caggion di man quando soverchia;
query.error: **English:** 4 and the night, which circles opposite to it, 5 was emerging from the Ganges with Libra, 6 which falls from its hand when it is overcome;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 sì che le bianche e le vermiglie guance, 8 là dov’ i’ era, de la bella Aurora 9 per troppa etate divenivan rance.
query.error: **English:** 7 so that the white and red cheeks, 8 where I was, of beautiful Aurora 9 were becoming orange due to old age.
query.result: 7 swa ðæt ða hwitan and ða readan wangas, 8 ðær ic wæs, ðære fægeran Idage 9 ðurh ða miclan ylde bleoh bleowon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Noi eravam lunghesso mare ancora, 11 come gente che pensa a suo cammino, 12 che va col cuore e col corpo dimora.
query.error: **English:** 10 We were still along the shore, 11 like people who are thinking about their journey, 12 who go with their heart but stay with their body.
query.result: 10 We wæron ða giet ða on staðe, 11 swa ða men ðe ðæncað ymbe weg, 12 ðe gað mid heortan and mid lice wunað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Ed ecco, qual, sorpreso dal mattino, 14 per li grossi vapor Marte rosseggia 15 giù nel ponente sovra ’l suol marino,
query.error: **English:** 13 And behold, just as, surprised by the morning, 14 Mars reddens through the thick vapors 15 down in the west over the sea floor,
query.result: 13 And efne swa, ða ðe morgentid becom, 14 ðurh ða ðiccan mistas Mars reade scineð 15 niðer on ðam west ofer ðæs sæes grund,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 cotal m’apparve, s’io ancor lo veggia, 17 un lume per lo mar venir sì ratto, 18 che ’l muover suo nessun volar pareggia.
query.error: **English:** 16 so appeared to me, if I still see it, 17 a light coming so swiftly across the sea 18 that no flight can match its motion.
query.result: 16 swylc me ðuhte, gif ic ðæt gyt geseo, 17 leoht ofer ðone sæ swa radlice cuman, 18 ðæt nænig fugel ne mæg ðære flyhte efnan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Dal qual com’ io un poco ebbi ritratto 20 l’occhio per domandar lo duca mio, 21 rividil più lucente e maggior fatto.
query.error: **English:** 19 From which, when I had withdrawn my eyes a little, 20 to ask my guide, 21 I saw him again, brighter and larger in stature.
query.result: 19 Fram ðam ic ða mine eagan lyt 20 awende ðurh ðone wudu to ðam lareowe, 21 ða geseah ic hine eft brihtne and fægerne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Poi d’ogne lato ad esso m’appario 23 un non sapeva che bianco, e di sotto 24 a poco a poco un altro a lui uscìo.
query.error: **English:** 22 Then on each side of it appeared to me 23 one who did not know what color was, and from below 24 little by little another came forth to him.
query.result: 22 ða on æghwylce healfe hit ætywde me 23 an ðe ne cuðe hwæt hwít wæs, and of neoðan 24 lyt and lyt an oðer him æfter com.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Lo mio maestro ancor non facea motto, 26 mentre che i primi bianchi apparver ali; 27 allor che ben conobbe il galeotto,
query.error: **English:** 25 My master still did not speak a word, 26 while the first white streaks appeared in the sky; 27 then, when he clearly recognized the traitor,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 gridò: «Fa, fa che le ginocchia cali. 29 Ecco l’angel di Dio: piega le mani; 30 omai vedrai di sì fatti officiali.
query.error: **English:** 28 he cried out: "Make, make your knees bend. 29 Behold the angel of God: fold your hands; 30 now you will see such officers.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Vedi che sdegna li argomenti umani, 32 sì che remo non vuol, né altro velo 33 che l’ali sue, tra liti sì lontani.
query.error: **English:** 31 See how he disdains human arguments, 32 so that he wants no oar, nor other sail 33 than his own wings, between shores so distant.
query.result: 31 Gesyh ðu ðæt he forhogað manna geþohtas, 32 swa ðæt he nele wios ne oðer segel 33 buton his agenre fyðere, betwux ðam landum swa feor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Vedi come l’ha dritte verso ’l cielo, 35 trattando l’aere con l’etterne penne, 36 che non si mutan come mortal pelo».
query.error: **English:** 34 See how she has her wings pointed straight toward heaven, 35 beating the air with her eternal feathers, 36 which are not changed like mortal hair.
query.result: 34 Geseoh ðu hu ðæt heo hæfð hire ða wyngas to ðam heofone, 35 ðurh ðone lyft fleogende mid ðam ecan ðryððum, 36 ða ne awæðað swa ðæs deadlican mannes hær.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Poi, come più e più verso noi venne 38 l’uccel divino, più chiaro appariva: 39 per che l’occhio da presso nol sostenne,
query.error: **English:** 37 Then, as the divine bird came closer and closer to us, 38 it appeared more clearly: 39 because of which my eye could not bear it from up close,
query.result: 37 Þa, swa swa he neor and neor com 38 ðam fugle ðam godcundan, ðy he æteowde swiðor: 39 for ðam ðin eage ne mihte ðoligan ðæt he hine gesawe gehende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 ma chinail giuso; e quei sen venne a riva 41 con un vasello snelletto e leggero, 42 tanto che l’acqua nulla ne ’nghiottiva.
query.error: **English:** 40 but I lowered it down; and it came to shore 41 with a swift and light vessel, 42 so much so that the water did not swallow any of it.
query.result: 40 ac ic abeah ða niðor; and he com ða to lande 41 mid anum scipheorne lyftlicum and leohtlicum, 42 swa ðæt ðæt wæter næfre ne onfeng ðæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Da poppa stava il celestial nocchiero, 44 tal che faria beato pur descripto; 45 e più di cento spirti entro sediero.
query.error: **English:** 43 At the stern stood the celestial helmsman, 44 such that he would make one blessed just by describing him; 45 and more than a hundred spirits sat within.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 ‘In exitu Isräel de Aegypto’ 47 cantavan tutti insieme ad una voce 48 con quanto di quel salmo è poscia scripto.
query.error: **English:** 46 ‘When Israel went out of Egypt’ 47 they all sang together with one voice 48 with as much of that psalm as is written afterwards.
query.result: 46 ‘In exitu Israhel de Aegypto’ 47 sungon ða ealle mid anre stæfne 48 swa mycel swa ðæs sealmes is siððan awriten.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Poi fece il segno lor di santa croce; 50 ond’ ei si gittar tutti in su la piaggia: 51 ed el sen gì, come venne, veloce.
query.error: **English:** 49 Then he made for them the sign of the holy cross; 50 and they all threw themselves down on the shore: 51 and he went away, as he had come, swiftly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 La turba che rimase lì, selvaggia 53 parea del loco, rimirando intorno 54 come colui che nove cose assaggia.
query.error: **English:** 52 The crowd that remained there, wild, 53 seemed to be of the place, looking around 54 like someone who tastes new things.
query.result: 52 Þæt folc ðe ðær læfde, wudu wilde, 53 wæs ðæs stowes gelicost, wlitig and wlonc, 54 swylce se ðe niwe ðing onfundeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Da tutte parti saettava il giorno 56 lo sol, ch’avea con le saette conte 57 di mezzo ’l ciel cacciato Capricorno,
query.error: **English:** 55 From every side the day was shooting forth 56 the sun, which had with its arrows driven Capricorn 57 from the middle of the sky,
query.result: 55 Of ælce healfe sceað ðone dæg 56 sunne, se ðe hæfde mid his strælum 57 of middes heofone huntad Capricorne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 quando la nova gente alzò la fronte 59 ver’ noi, dicendo a noi: «Se voi sapete, 60 mostratene la via di gire al monte».
query.error: **English:** 58 when the new people raised their faces 59 toward us, saying to us: "If you know, 60 show us the way to go to the mountain."
query.result: 58 ða ða ða niwan men ahafen hæfdon 59 heora nebbu ongen us, secgende to us: 60 "Gif ge cunnon, tæcað us ðone weg to ðam munte."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 E Virgilio rispuose: «Voi credete 62 forse che siamo esperti d’esto loco; 63 ma noi siam peregrin come voi siete.
query.error: **English:** 61 And Virgil replied: "You perhaps believe 62 that we are experts in this place; 63 but we are pilgrims just like you are.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Dianzi venimmo, innanzi a voi un poco, 65 per altra via, che fu sì aspra e forte, 66 che lo salire omai ne parrà gioco».
query.error: **English:** 64 We came here just now, a little while before you, 65 by another way, which was so rough and difficult, 66 that the ascent will now seem like child's play to us."
query.result: 64 We coman her nu hwile ær iow, 65 ðurh oðerne weg, se wæs swiðe earfoð, 66 ðæt ðe upgang us nu bið lytel gamen."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 L’anime, che si fuor di me accorte, 68 per lo spirare, ch’i’ era ancor vivo, 69 maravigliando diventaro smorte.
query.error: **English:** 67 The souls, who had noticed that I was alive, 68 because of my breathing, 69 turned pale with wonder.
query.result: 67 Þa sawla, ða ðe waron fram me afyrhte, 68 ðurh ðone wind, ðe ic wæs gyt lybbende, 69 wundrigende wurdon astyrede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 E come a messagger che porta ulivo 71 tragge la gente per udir novelle, 72 e di calcar nessun si mostra schivo,
query.error: **English:** 70 And like a messenger who bears an olive branch 71 draws people to hear news, 72 and no one shows any reluctance to press forward,
query.result: 70 And swa swa sande ðe ðone selebeam bereð 71 teohð ða leoda ðæt hi ða niwan tiðende gehyran, 72 and nan ne bið ðæs swiðe forðscyldig,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 così al viso mio s’affisar quelle 74 anime fortunate tutte quante, 75 quasi oblïando d’ire a farsi belle.
query.error: **English:** 73 so those fortunate souls all fixed their gaze 74 on my face, 75 almost forgetting to go and make themselves beautiful.
query.result: 73 swa ða gesæligan sawla ealle 74 fæste ða heora gesihðe on ðinum ansyne, 75 swa ðæt hi nænigne omsorg hæfdon ðæs ðæt hi woldon faran and heora wlite gebetan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Io vidi una di lor trarresi avante 77 per abbracciarmi con sì grande affetto, 78 che mosse me a far lo somigliante.
query.error: **English:** 76 I saw one of them step forward 77 to embrace me with such great affection, 78 that it moved me to do the same.
query.result: 76 Ic geseah ða ænne of ðam ðær forðgangan 77 ðæt he wolde mec mid earmum gefôn, 78 ðæt hit me to ðam ilcan gewende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Ohi ombre vane, fuor che ne l’aspetto! 80 tre volte dietro a lei le mani avvinsi, 81 e tante mi tornai con esse al petto.
query.error: **English:** 79 Oh, empty shades, except in appearance! 80 Three times I clasped my hands behind her, 81 and as many times I brought them back to my chest.
query.result: 79 Ea, wædle gedwola, buton on ansyne! 80 ðriwa ic æfter hire honda fæðmde, 81 and swa oft ic me mid ðam earmum gewende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Di maraviglia, credo, mi dipinsi; 83 per che l’ombra sorrise e si ritrasse, 84 e io, seguendo lei, oltre mi pinsi.
query.error: **English:** 82 With wonder, I believe, I was painted; 83 because of which the shade smiled and withdrew, 84 and I, following it, thought further.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Soavemente disse ch’io posasse; 86 allor conobbi chi era, e pregai 87 che, per parlarmi, un poco s’arrestasse.
query.error: **English:** 85 Gently he said that I should rest; 86 then I recognized who he was, and I begged 87 that he stop for a while to speak with me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Rispuosemi: «Così com’ io t’amai 89 nel mortal corpo, così t’amo sciolta: 90 però m’arresto; ma tu perché vai?».
query.error: **English:** 88 He answered me: "Just as I loved you 89 in your mortal body, so I love you freed: 90 therefore I stop; but why do you go?"
query.result: 88 He andswarode me: "Swa swa ic ðe lufode 89 on ðinum deadlicum lichaman, swa ðe ic lufige alysed: 90 forðæm ic me gewende; ac hwi gewitst ðu?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 «Casella mio, per tornar altra volta 92 là dov’ io son, fo io questo vïaggio», 93 diss’ io; «ma a te com’ è tanta ora tolta?».
query.error: **English:** 91 "Casella mine, in order to return once more 92 there where I am, I make this journey," 93 I said; "but how has so much time been taken from you?"
query.result: 91 "Casella min, for ðonon eft cuman 92 ðær ic eom, ðone weg ic fare," 93 cwæð ic; "ac ðe hu ðus lange wæs benumen?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Ed elli a me: «Nessun m’è fatto oltraggio, 95 se quei che leva quando e cui li piace, 96 più volte m’ha negato esto passaggio;
query.error: **English:** 94 And he to me: "No outrage is done to me, 95 if he who rises when and where it pleases him, 96 has many times denied me this passage;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 ché di giusto voler lo suo si face: 98 veramente da tre mesi elli ha tolto 99 chi ha voluto intrar, con tutta pace.
query.error: **English:** 97 for his will is done with justice: 98 truly for three months he has taken 99 whoever has wanted to enter, with complete peace.
query.result: 97 for his will is done with justice: 98 truly for three months he has taken 99 whoever has wanted to enter, with complete peace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Ond’ io, ch’era ora a la marina vòlto 101 dove l’acqua di Tevero s’insala, 102 benignamente fu’ da lui ricolto.
query.error: **English:** 100 And I, who was now turned toward the shore 101 where the water of the Tiber becomes salty, 102 was kindly received by him.
query.result: 100 And ic, ðe wæs ða to ðære sæ wended 101 ðær Tibre flōd on tyn færeð, 102 wæs ðær bliðelice fram him onfangen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 A quella foce ha elli or dritta l’ala, 104 però che sempre quivi si ricoglie 105 qual verso Acheronte non si cala».
query.error: **English:** 103 At that opening he now has his right wing, 104 because it is always gathered there, 105 whoever does not descend toward Acheron.
query.result: 103 Æt ðære wætre hæfð he nu ðone swiðran earm, 104 forðæm ðe he ðær simle gegaderad is, 105 swylc ne stigeð to Acheron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 E io: «Se nuova legge non ti toglie 107 memoria o uso a l’amoroso canto 108 che mi solea quetar tutte mie doglie,
query.error: **English:** 106 And I: "If a new law does not take away from you 107 memory or practice of the loving song 108 that used to soothe all my sorrows,
query.result: 106 And ic: "Gif ðiu niwe lagu ðe ne benimeð 107 gemynd oððe gewunan ðæs luflican sangas 108 ðe me ær gewunode ða earfeðu ealle geswencan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 di ciò ti piaccia consolare alquanto 110 l’anima mia, che, con la sua persona 111 venendo qui, è affannata tanto!».
query.error: **English:** 109 may it please you to console somewhat 110 my soul, which, coming here with its body, 111 is so distressed!".
query.result: 109 ðonne ðe gelician mæg ðurh ðone 110 ðone modsefan ðe mid ðære lichoman 111 hider cumen swiðe gedrefed is!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 ‘Amor che ne la mente mi ragiona’ 113 cominciò elli allor sì dolcemente, 114 che la dolcezza ancor dentro mi suona.
query.error: **English:** 112 "Love, that discourses to me in my mind," 113 he began then so sweetly, 114 that the sweetness still resounds within me.
query.result: 112 "Lufu ðe on ðam mode ðe me ræseð" 113 ða ongann he ða sprecan swiðe swetlice, 114 ðæt ðæt swetnes gyt ðær innan me singð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Lo mio maestro e io e quella gente 116 ch’eran con lui parevan sì contenti, 117 come a nessun toccasse altro la mente.
query.error: **English:** 115 My master and I and those people 116 who were with him seemed so content, 117 as if nothing else touched their minds.
query.result: 115 Min lareow and ic and ða leode 116 ðe wæron mid him ðuhte swa blide, 117 swa ðæt nanwuht elles ne wende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Noi eravam tutti fissi e attenti 119 a le sue note; ed ecco il veglio onesto 120 gridando: «Che è ciò, spiriti lenti?
query.error: **English:** 118 We were all fixed and attentive 119 to his words; and behold the venerable old man 120 crying out: "What is this, slow spirits?
query.result: 118 We wæron ealle fæste and georne 119 to his wordum; and ða ða ealda wyrhta 120 cleopiende: "Hwæt is ðis, slaweste gastas?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 qual negligenza, quale stare è questo? 122 Correte al monte a spogliarvi lo scoglio 123 ch’esser non lascia a voi Dio manifesto».
query.error: **English:** 121 What negligence, what standing around is this? 122 Run to the mountain to strip away the rock 123 that does not allow God to be manifest to you."
query.result: 121 Hwilc gymeleaste, hwilc standende is ðis? 122 Runað to ðam munte to unhilden ðone stan 123 ðe ne læt ðeow God gesyne beon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Come quando, cogliendo biado o loglio, 125 li colombi adunati a la pastura, 126 queti, sanza mostrar l’usato orgoglio,
query.error: **English:** 124 Like when, gathering corn or darnel, 125 the doves gathered together for pasture, 126 quiet, without showing their usual pride,
query.result: 124 Swa swa ðonne, ceorlas sæd gesamnigende 125 culufru, on æcere ætsamne sittende, 126 swylce, ðone ylcan oferhygðe forlætende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 se cosa appare ond’ elli abbian paura, 128 subitamente lasciano star l’esca, 129 perch’ assaliti son da maggior cura;
query.error: **English:** 127 if something appears that frightens them, 128 suddenly they stop eating, 129 because they are assailed by a greater fear;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 così vid’ io quella masnada fresca 131 lasciar lo canto, e fuggir ver’ la costa, 132 com’ om che va, né sa dove rïesca;
query.error: **English:** 130 so I saw that fresh company 131 leave their song and flee towards the coast, 132 like a man who goes and does not know where he will end up;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 né la nostra partita fu men tosta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and our departure was no less hasty.
query.result: 133 ne ure sið wæs na ðy læssa hræd.
